name: Potassium Chloride
indications: potassium chloride indicated treatment prophylaxis hypokalemia without metabolic alkalosis , patients dietary management potassium-rich foods diuretic dose reduction insufficient .
contraindications: dilute prior . ( 2.1 , 5.1 ) monitor serum potassium adjust accordingly ( 2.2 , 2.3 ) serum potassium concentration < 2.5 meq/l , intravenous potassium instead oral supplementation ( 2.1 ) treatment hypokalemia : adults : initial doses range 40-100 meq/day 2-5 divided doses : limit doses 40 meq per dose . total daily dose exceed 200 meq ( 2.2 ) pediatric patients aged birth 16 years old : 2-4 meq/kg/day divided doses ; exceed 1 meq/kg single dose 40 meq whichever lower ; deficits severe ongoing losses great , consider intravenous therapy . total daily dose exceed 100 meq ( 2.3 ) maintenance prophylaxis hypokalemia : adults : typical dose 20 meq per day ( 2.2 ) pediatric patients aged birth 16 years old : typical dose 1 meq/kg/day . exceed 3 meq/kg/day ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions: potassium chloride oral solution , light pink orange powder available one strength follows : 20 meqndc # 0603-1554-10 pouch . pouch contains 1.5 g potassium chloride providing potassium 20 meq chloride 20 meq ndc # 0603-1554-16 carton 30 pouches ndc # 0603-1554-04 carton 100 pouches
adverseReactions: potassium chloride contraindicated patients potassium sparing diuretics .
indications_original: Potassium Chloride is indicated for the treatment and prophylaxis of hypokalemia with or without metabolic alkalosis, in patients for whom dietary management with potassium-rich foods or diuretic dose reduction is insufficient.
contraindications_original: Dilute prior to administration. ( 2.1 , 5.1 ) Monitor serum potassium and adjust dosage accordingly ( 2.2 , 2.3 ) If serum potassium concentration is <2.5 mEq/L, use intravenous potassium instead of oral supplementation ( 2.1 ) Treatment of hypokalemia: Adults: Initial doses range from 40-100 mEq/day in 2-5 divided doses: limit doses to 40 mEq per dose. Total daily dose should not exceed 200 mEq ( 2.2 ) Pediatric patients aged birth to 16 years old: 2-4 mEq/kg/day in divided doses; not to exceed 1 mEq/kg as a single dose or 40 mEq whichever is lower; if deficits are severe or ongoing losses are great, consider intravenous therapy. Total daily dose should not exceed 100 mEq ( 2.3 ) Maintenance or Prophylaxis of hypokalemia: Adults: Typical dose is 20 mEq per day ( 2.2 ) Pediatric patients aged birth to 16 years old: typical dose is 1 mEq/kg/day. Do not exceed 3 mEq/kg/day ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Potassium Chloride for Oral Solution, is a light pink to orange powder available in one strength as follows:
                  20 mEqNDC# 0603-1554-10 pouch. Each pouch contains 1.5 g of potassium chloride providing potassium 20 mEq and chloride 20 mEq NDC# 0603-1554-16 carton of 30 pouches NDC# 0603-1554-04 carton of 100 pouches
adverseReactions_original: Potassium chloride is contraindicated in patients on potassium sparing diuretics.
